ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: In general, the questions in this survey are not written for evaluation of a clinic course.

I enjoyed this class because I got to work with a public utility. Really the only class at Yale that could offer me this opportunity. Classvalue was hit or miss. Totally depends on the guest lecturer. Guy from Sierra Club was a joke.

This was my second semester with the clinic, so I didn't go through the class hours or non-client related assignments. The client work that I did, however, was both challenging and incredibly rewarding. Having the opportunity to go to Greece to work with our team was critical to solidifying lessons learned and getting a sense of both the bigger and more minute pictures of what motivates conservation in this part of the world.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Real world, client based experience
The best aspect of this course is that it gave students the opportunity to work with clients and gain experience in consulting.
The teachers and the clients
Real world application of environmental management.
Working with public utility.
Real world experience. Struggling with clients. The opportunity to see the diversity of conservation related motivations.
Being able to work with a client is a unique and valuable experience. I learned so much from working with my client and with my group.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: This question really depends on the particular group or client in question, since it is highly variable.
It's good
Instructors could be more involved in project planning. Consistent check ins would be helpful.
Class lectures can be bad. Moot court was sort of pointless.

Our client(s) were completely unprepared for the kind of project they worked on. The instructors need to do a better job coordinating with clients ahead of time to make sure their projects are feasible, rather than having these problems fall on the students as they did with my group. If the instructors don't want to/have time to do this, then they need to be more accommodating of groups when they have issues with their clients.
The class sections, while interesting, did not build on each other.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Great to have experience with what we learn in other FES courses.
Good experience and contacts made

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: As a capstone.
Experience
Real world application of environmental management.
I wanted to work on an energy project.
capstone requirement

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: The overall experience gained through this course met my expectations in some ways in that I was working with a client. However, my expectations were not met in other ways, since my project really only involved writing a research paper as I would have written in another class.
Yes
Yes.
Yes.
Yes, absolutely. I learned so much from this course!

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: The advantages included being able to share the workload and bounce ideas off one another. The major disadvantage, as is true with many other group projects, was unequal balance of the workload.
Some group members did not carry their weight and lied about their hours

I was able to learn another perspective. However, my group member was not the most responsive or collaborative and I may have been able to accomplish more had I been working individually from the outset.
I worked with my friends, so that was cool. Great group.

Our group of 5 felt too large to be optimally productive. Having a diversity of perspectives is certainly interesting, but coordinating schedules and making sure things are accomplished was difficult.

I do not think there were any disadvantages of the group work--working with groups is very common in the workplace, and this class gives you a real taste of what it's like to take on a real-world, complex project.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Choose your projects carefully because you spend a lot of time workingon them, so you really need to be interested in the subject!
Get a good project and team
Take it if a project jumps off the page to you.
Definitely take it. It is one of the most valuable experiences I have had in graduate school so far.
